solution_line_template: The medium-sized hole leaks at a rate of one-half that of the largest hole, or {largest_rate}/{medium_rate_divisor}=<<{largest_rate}/{medium_rate_divisor}={medium_rate}>>{medium_rate} ounces per minute.

The small-sized hole leaks at a rate of one-third that of the medium-sized hole, or {medium_rate}/{small_rate_divisor}=<<{medium_rate}/{small_rate_divisor}={small_rate}>>{small_rate} ounces per minute.
Combined, the three holes leak at a rate of {largest_rate}+{medium_rate}+{small_rate}=<<{largest_rate}+{medium_rate}+{small_rate}={combined_rate}>>{combined_rate} ounces per minute.
Since one hour is 60 minutes, two hours is {hours}*{minutes_per_hour}=<<{hours}*{minutes_per_hour}={total_minutes}>>{total_minutes} minutes.
In total, over the two hours, the three holes will leak a combined {total_minutes}*{combined_rate}=<<{total_minutes}*{combined_rate}={total_leaked}>>{total_leaked} ounces of water.
